When using the excellent jmxclient utilitly, I'm having trouble 
supplying =
arguments to operations. I *am* able to use no-arg 
operations successfully=
.

I'm attempting to follow the example in the Client source:

        " To=
 set set logging level to FINE on a password protected 
JVM:\n" +
        "=
     % java -jar cmdline-jmxclient-X.X.jar 
controlRole:secret" +
        "=
 localhost:8081 //\n" +
        "         java.util.logging:type=3DLogging =
//\n" +
        "         setLoggerLevel=3Dorg.archive.crawler.Heritrix,FIN=
E";

But every time I try to specify an arg, I'm getting

Exception in thre=
ad "main" java.text.ParseException: Failed parse of 
setLoggerLevel=3Dorg.a=
rchive.crawler.Heritrix,FINE
        at org.archive.jmx.Client$CommandParse=
.parse(client.java:573)

Is the format supposed to be: operation=3DargType,=
argValue ? The docs 
aren't quite clear to me...

I tried aiming jmxclient =
at one of my own apps, and I'm able to call 
no-arg operations perfectly:

=
java -jar cmdline-jmxclient.jar org.archive.jmx.Client 
admin:password loca=
lhost:8871 global-scope:name=3DTestBean testNoArgs
01/03/2007 14:25:57 -050=
0 org.archive.jmx.Client testNoArgs: I work!

But if I call an operation th=
at takes a single string, I cannot get 
it to work. The operation signature=
 is:

public String testArgs(String argName);

testArgs=3Dsomestring
testAr=
gs=3Djava.lang.String,somestring
testArgs=3DargName:somestring

With each, =
I get the same ParseException I listed above.

Any help is greatly apprecia=
ted.

(And as I said, great app!)

Thanks,

Mike Brown
